Generative AI and the Nature of Work

Recent advances in artificial intelligence (AI) technology demonstrate considerable potential to complement human capital intensive activities. While an emerging literature documents wide-ranging productivity effects of AI, relatively little attention has been paid to how AI might change the nature of work itself. How do individuals, especially those in the knowledge economy, adjust how they work when they start using AI? Using the setting of open source software, we study individual level effects that AI

Key Concepts:

  • Impact of AI on human capital intensive activities
  • Adjustments in work behavior when using AI
  • Individual-level effects of AI on productivity
  • Impact of generative AI on work processes
  • Changes in nature of work due to AI adoption
  • Shift from auxiliary project management to core coding activities
Generative AI Artificial Intelligence Nature of Work Knowledge Economy generative AI labor augmenting technical change open source software productivity work processes AI adoption
